name: deimosrising
text: What did Todd want to know? We may never.

name: snatch22
text: Oh my god.  So chubbied.  So hilarious.

name: daidai
text: It is the prime example of comedy that cannot be planned

name: littlefatdog
text: I'm pretty sure it had something to do with the next day's comic, starring Captain Todd.

name: wfl
text: The nutrition factor of water, pretty much.

name: cracklewater
text: Volume of the average stinker?

name: skviiier
text: I'm feeling pretty thick here for not understanding a comment with 201 chubbies, anyone feel like explaining it to me?

name: teezee
text: "Todd called.  We had a good chat. He wanted to know if..."

name: fuzzyshoo
text: The joke is that the comment about the cut-off line is in itself, a cut-off line.

name: soticoto
text: If .

name: overmedicated
text: Ray is a multimillionaire, yet is still reduced to drawing on himself to pass the time? So much for the American Dream, I guess.

name: aaron_haynes
text: You can be rich and still have strange cares.

name: dropkickpikachu
text: It's usually the easiest way, really.

name: spinynorman
text: If certain things no longer offer entertainment, you must re-evaluate your life. You've become jaded.

name: invidious
text: Like cake-sitting.

name: envika
text: or coprophilia, in the case of chuck berry

name: slalvation
text: That IS the American Dream.

name: bixschmix
text: Especially if it's a Mr. Sniff marker. ( Especially a grape one.

name: bixschmix
text: Pretend I closed those parentheses, OK? Thanks.

name: tekende
text: I am pretending so hard right now.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: until they are so closed .

name: nabeel84
text: Ray does a great Roast Beef.

name: aaron_haynes
text: That's my favorite part of this strip, the fact that it actually sounds like Ray trying to talk like Roast Beef.

name: achilleselbow
text: "Studied a microscope" pretty much gives it away.

name: nurdbot
text: I love how Beef doesn't want to trouble anyone, even after death.

name: jezebel
text: Spending hours imagining all of the places he might be found dead and then listing them so no one has to look too hard.  No one is as considerate as Beef.

name: nutmeg
text: my god i remember this strip word for word even from 2004. THIS is the one that made me fall in love with achewood.

name: centipede_damascus
text: Carryin' on in a way such as a fool does.

name: paco
text: I love the contrast between Ray's entry and Beef's

name: qatipay
text: I want to know more about the good chat Beef had with Todd.

name: darkwaffle
text: I think it is symbolic that Ray is not blogging with his crown at this time.

name: le_chien_manquee
text: i kinda like the idea that he only wears the crown after fucking a girl with a peeking thong.

name: dovey
text: It's because he didn't get Mad Rutty.

name: soilentshuggah
text: First Achewood strip. God, the dots around the arm always crack me up.

name: andrew_
text:
studied a microscope!

I have nothing funny to say about that, I can only laugh.

name: cailetshadow
text: It is very sad that Ray keeps his arm held out for three full panels, hoping for Beef's approval of his arm dots.

name: aliiis
text:
for this reason, I 5'd this strip

Now I have 5'd three strips in a row, chronologically. They all made me laugh so much. It feels STRANGE.

name: dtuba
text:
Panel 4:
gives up
puts arm down

name: sidxdeadgod
text: I love how Beef's journal goes from something as extreme as getting scalded in a hot water heater explosion to his good chat with Todd.

name: androo
text: Funny that Roast Beef actually uses proper punctuation in his journal, after Ray mimics him as having none in the frame before.

name: ovenface
text: I guess his particular mode of speech is really just his nervous anti-social behavior showing itself.

name: tellumo
text: Note also that Ray makes the common mistake that Frankenstein was the name of the monster, not its creator. Beef, being Beef, gets it right.

name: trollcollins
text: Yes! That is a slightly irksome mistake a lot of people make. The monster ain't gotta name, guys, 'cause there was never anyone to nurture him.

name: autrepoupee
text:
He did have a name, it's just no one cared to hear it. :0(

It was Trey.

name: locke1127
text:
actually he's also wrong

Frankenstein was a student but he never finished, so he's not actually a Dr.

name: kickstart
text:
This happens to me all the time, mostly with my roommate. I'll have some great-but-mostly-silly idea, such as "I would be a really great ice chopper for boats in the arctic" or something, and he just has to puke all over it.

(I realize this vergest on GAB,YAW but was wondering if anyone had this happen to them, a friend nit-picking their fanciful ideas for no reason other than to be a dick)

name: autrepoupee
text:
This describes my relationship with pretty much everything in my life.

" Hey guys, it'd be kind of cool to be able to hold your breath underwater for upwards of ten minutes ."
"FUCK YOU POLAR BEARS CAN DO IT"
"yeah seriously why are you so IGNORANT"
" I'm just sayin' is all "
"SHUT UP SHUT UP WOOF WOOF"

name: desert_donkey
text: rad = 5

name: mehighlow
text:
Also - Ray: Times New Roman, Beef: Courier New.
Speaks volumes.

name: tonyhighwind
text: Same planet, different worlds.  This is the exact thing I imagine happening whenever I talk to anyone, only going on in the grey matter instead of written down.  I am usually Beef.

name: vulpes-aurum
text: It was Colonel Mustard with the rope in the breakfast nook. (read the alt text)

name: treatyofparis
text: Looking back through the archive, I realized that this strip is one of the more succint accounts of Ray and  Roast Beef's relationship, what with both with Ray's R.B. impression and the presentation of both sides of the story.

name: panthera3000
text: Beef posts with the lights off

name: theirateturk
text: This could be my favourite comic

name: epicurus
text: It's hard to say what is more stupid: Ray thinking that him drawing the dots on his arm was worth showing to someone, or Roast Beef for being a pedantic asshole
